titles.title: Providing for consideration of the bill (H.R. 2555) making appropriations for the Department of Homeland Security for the fiscal year ending September 30, 2004, and for other purposes.

action.text: The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 108-175, by Mr. Diaz-Balart, L..

Waives all points of order against consideration of the bill. The bill shall be read for amendment by paragraph. Waives points of order against provisions in the bill for failure to comply with sec. 501 of H. Con. Res. 95, (prohibiting advanced appropriations) and clause 2 of rule XXI (prohibiting unauthorized appropriations or legislative provisions in an appropriations bill), except as specified in the resolution. Authorizes the Chair to accord priority in recognition to Members who have pre-printed their amendments in the Congressional Record.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 71.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 293.
On ordering the previous question Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 221 - 196 (Roll no. 301).

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by recorded vote: 220 - 197 (Roll no. 302).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/24/2003--Passed House without amendment. (This measure has not been amended since it was introduced. The summary of that version is repeated here.)Sets forth the rule for the consideration of H.R. 2555 (FY 2004 Department of Homeland Security appropriations).
